title: Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles
summary: The poster discusses the influence of drug-polymer interactions on release kinetics of poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and polylactide/ethylene glycol copolymers (PLA/PEG) nanoparticles in microfluidic systems, highlighting their potential to improve antimicrobial resistance by offering precise control over nanocarrier characteristics and encapsulation efficiency.
methods: The text does not contain any specific methodological details or experimental procedures related to the research topic "Influence of Drug-Polymer Interactions on Release Kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PET Nanoparticles". The provided text appears to be an abstract or introduction section discussing the background and objectives of the study rather than describing its methodology.
results: The study investigates how drug-polymer interactions affect the release kinetics of Poly(lactic-co-glycolic acid) (PLGA) and Polylactide-co-Glycolide (PLA)/Polyethylene Glycol (PEG) nanoparticles (NPs). The research provides insights into optimizing these systems to enhance their performance in controlled drug delivery applications.
